hook.text: You snapped at someone you love over nothing. Five minutes later, you couldn't explain why you did it.

buildup.text: Daniel Goleman called this an amygdala hijack. Emotions overwhelm rational thought before you can intervene.

discovery.text: The amygdala processes threats faster than the cortex can reason. Reaction comes before reflection.

twist.text: Stress lowers the hijack threshold. When you're already stressed, smaller triggers cause larger outbursts.

climax.text: Pausing for six seconds lets the cortex catch up. That brief gap is enough to choose your response.

punchline.text: Six seconds between trigger and response changes everything.

quiz.question: What is an amygdala hijack?
options: Emotions overwhelming rational thought before you can think
